sentences.english: Many people overestimate the benefits of vitamin C and other antioxidants.
sentences.chinese: 许多人高估了维C和其它抗氧化剂的好处。

sentences.english: "the black screen" to the computer user's harm, overestimates greatly.
sentences.chinese: “黑屏”对电脑用户的危害，被大大地高估了。

sentences.english: Social analysts often overrate the rate of change .
sentences.chinese: 社会分析家往往过高估计发生变化的速度。

sentences.english: Yes, he is a gigantic egotistical overrated artist.
sentences.chinese: 没错，他是一个极度自负的却被高估的演员。

sentences.english: Many new business owners greatly over-estimate the amount of money they need.
sentences.chinese: 很多创业者都高估了自己需要的创业资金数量。

sentences.english: Once again, Beijing may have overplayed its hand.
sentences.chinese: 中国当局有可能再度高估了自己的上风。

sentences.english: If you ask me, I think they're overvaluing our company.
sentences.chinese: 如果你问我，我只能说他们高估了我们公司的市值。

sentences.english: My appeal to my fellow countrymen in India, please don't try to over-estimate India's growth.
sentences.chinese: 我对印度国民的呼吁是，请不要试图高估印度的发展。

sentences.english: He believes the company's PC contract manufacturing business is overvalued.
sentences.chinese: 哈里哈兰认为华硕的个人电脑合同制造业务被高估。

sentences.english: Don't think too high of yourself and belittle others, you'll pay for it.
sentences.chinese: 别太高估自己而轻蔑别人，那是要付出代价的。

sentences.english: The strong currency also meant that the Greek economy became totally uncompetitive.
sentences.chinese: 汇率高估也意味着希腊经济变得毫无竞争力。

sentences.english: Chinks are overestimating themselves after STEALING military hardware design details from US.
sentences.chinese: 从美国窃取军事机密后，中国佬开始高估自己。

sentences.english: Many, perhaps all, Internet stocks are hugely overvalued.
sentences.chinese: 很多，也许是所有的网络股都被大大高估了。

sentences.english: You vastly overrate your powers of persuasion.
sentences.chinese: 你太过高估了自己的说服力。

sentences.english: Studying overseas is an over-rated experience, what is your opinion?
sentences.chinese: 海外留学是一种被高估的经历，你认为呢？

sentences.english: Do not overestimate the importance of the economic problems.
sentences.chinese: 不要过高估计经济问题的重要性。

definition: to regard as having good prospects
to exceed/to overstep/to go too far/to encroach
to be unduly humble (idiom)/to undervalue oneself
